subject: Re: [junit] Simple JUnit with Annotations not working
msgSnippet: I copied the code in the mail. The problem showed up when I ran my class from ant 1.6.5. When I used ant 1.7 it was gone. So I guess the problem was with my
messageBody:
I copied the code in the mail. The problem showed up when I ran my class from ant 1.6.5. When I used ant 1.7 it was gone. So I guess the problem was with my configuration.

regards,
Suresh

On Tue, 6/9/09, David Saff <david@...> wrote:

From: David Saff <david@...>
Subject: Re: [junit] Simple JUnit with Annotations not working
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, June 9, 2009, 8:31 AM

















Suresh,



Can you send the class as you'd like it to be run, and what the

behavior is? That will help us understand what's going on. Thanks,



David Saff



On Tue, Jun 2, 2009 at 4:25 PM, Suresh Koya<surikoya@yahoo. com> wrote:

> ant test -Dtest.class. name=Annotations Test.

>

> When I changed the code as follows , there are two tests that got run successfully. I now have to extend TestCase and name methods starting with test. That was not my intention. I want to use annotations.

>

> import org.junit.Test;

> import static org.junit.Assert. * ;

> import junit.framework. TestCase;

> public class AnnotationsTest extends TestCase{

>     @Test

>     public void testAddition( ) {

>         assertEquals( 12, 7+5);

>     }

>

>     @Test

>     public void testSubtraction( ) {

>         assertEquals( 9, 12 -3);

>     }

> }

>

>

>
